column4: how do i create a shortcut for a command that is run so: "./commandname --options" ?
right click on desktop, choose 'create launcher'
it works here as i expect
does the command work from the command line?
but you said it runs from the command line fine ?
you need to specify the path to the program (i.e., /home/charlesj/software/cybercomm/foo)
where exactly is the client file? in your home directory?
and by '/path' do you actually mean '/home/charlesj/whatever' ?
ok, does '/path/crclient -u asdf' work from a different folder?
ok, it might be easiest to write a little wrapper script to first change to the right directory, then run the program
it's very easy; the file will have two lines: 'cd /path' and './crclient -u asdf'
yip. make sure to mark it executable (chmod a+x myscript.sh)
you can also set executable from nautilus (the gnome file explorer)
